item.title: 美国现房销售因价格创新高跌至九个月新低
item.description: 由于潜在购房者继续对创纪录的房价和高借贷成本感到不满，6 月份美国旧房销售量降至 9 个月以来的最低点。【原文：Sales of previously owned US homes fell in June to a nine-month low as potential buyers continued to bristle at record prices and high borrowing costs.】

item.title: 科塔克银行瞄准印度快速增长的富裕客户群
item.description: 科塔克-马恒达银行有限公司（Kotak Mahindra Bank Ltd. ）正在向其富裕客户提供财富管理和定制服务，因为为印度迅速增长的富裕人群提供服务的竞争正在升温。【原文：Kotak Mahindra Bank Ltd. is extending wealth management and bespoke services to its affluent customers as competition for servicing India’s rapidly-growing tribe of rich individuals heats up.】

item.title: 特朗普与日本达成协议，美国股市再创新高
item.description: 周三，随着唐纳德-特朗普总统与日本达成贸易协议，以及投资者为今天晚些时候的首轮大型科技财报做好准备，美国股市继续创纪录地反弹。【原文：The record-breaking rally in US equities continued on Wednesday as President Donald Trump reached a trade deal with Japan and investors geared up for the first round of big tech earnings later today.】

item.title: 穆迪利润超预期，显示信贷市场回暖
item.description: 债券评级机构和金融数据提供商穆迪公司（Moody's Corp.【原文：Moody’s Corp., a bond grader and financial data provider, reported second-quarter revenue that beat analysts’ estimates, underscoring credit markets’ relatively quick recovery from April’s tariff-fueled tumult.】

item.title: 高盛和纽约银行将在区块链上记录货币市场基金
item.description: 纽约银行梅隆公司（Bank of New York Mellon Corp）和高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Bank of New York Mellon Corp. and Goldman Sachs Group Inc. are collaborating to use blockchain technology to maintain an ownership record of money market funds.】

item.title: 南非塔斯社（TARS）正在用电锯锯开浪费的开支
item.description: 南非正在推出自己的美国政府效率部（DOGE），以削减被视为浪费或不符合政府政策的项目。【原文：South Africa is unleashing its own version of the US Department of Government Efficiency, or DOGE, to cut programs deemed as wasteful or not aligned with government policy.】

item.title: 乌兹别克斯坦 16.8 亿美元基金被指有意在伦敦两地上市
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，管理着价值 16.8 亿美元资产的乌兹别克斯坦国家投资基金正在为可能在伦敦和塔什干两地上市向银行征求意见。【原文：Uzbekistan’s national investment fund, which manages assets worth $1.68 billion, is sounding out banks for a potential dual listing in London and Tashkent, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 肯尼亚在 2027 年投票前收入增长受限
item.description: 据穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）称，肯尼亚政府将很难在2027年大选前推出增加收入的措施，这将制约政府缩小预算资金缺口的努力。【原文：Kenyan authorities will struggle to introduce revenue-raising measures before 2027 elections, constraining the government’s attempts to narrow the budget-financing gap, according to Moody’s Ratings.】

item.title: 随着 401（k）计划的推进，加密货币的财富投向因税收交易而增长
item.description: 随着华盛顿希望将美国 9 万亿美元的退休储蓄向另类资产开放，这一转变可能会为加密货币铺平道路，Eaglebrook Advisors Inc.【原文：As Washington looks to open up America’s $9 trillion in retirement savings to alternative assets — a shift that may pave the way for crypto — Eaglebrook Advisors Inc. offers a glimpse into how digital assets are being integrated into professionally managed investment accounts.】

item.title: 杰克-多西的科技愿景成为焦点，布洛克进入 S&P 500 指数
item.description: 杰克-多西（Jack Dorsey）的布洛克公司（Block Inc.【原文：Jack Dorsey’s Block Inc. joins the coveted S&P 500 on Wednesday, a symbolic milestone that puts the digital finance firm — pursuing everything from mobile banking to Bitcoin mining — under Wall Street’s spotlight.】

item.title: 阿根廷米莱的奢侈品繁荣掩盖了大众的绝望情绪
item.description:
住宅、汽车和航班的蓬勃发展与空荡荡的商店和餐馆形成鲜明对比。【原文：

A boom in homes, cars and flights contrasts with empty shops and restaurants.

】

item.title: 优步在美国测试匹配女性乘客和司机的选项
item.description: 优步科技公司（Uber Technologies Inc.【原文：Uber Technologies Inc. is piloting a new ride type in the US that will match female riders and drivers, expanding access to a safety feature it already offers in some international markets.】

item.title: 贝森特表示 "不急于 "选择美联储鲍威尔的继任者
item.description: 财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）表示，"不急于 "确定美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）的继任者，提名人选有可能来自现任董事会成员或地区银行的负责人。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said that there’s “no rush” to identify a successor to Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, and that a nominee could potentially come from current board members or the heads of the district banks.】

item.title: 印度将批准新季白糖出口的信号导致白糖下跌
item.description: 白糖期货跌至三周低点，因为市场预期全球第二大白糖种植国印度将允许在下一季装运白糖，从而提振全球供应前景。【原文：Sugar futures fell to a three-week low amid expectations that India, the world’s second-largest grower, will allow shipments in the forthcoming season in a boost to global supply prospects.】

item.title: Sonos 任命汤姆-康拉德（Tom Conrad）为永久首席执行官，谋求扭亏为盈
item.description: Sonos Inc.任命临时领导人汤姆-康拉德（Tom Conrad）为下一任首席执行官，表达了对他为这个陷入困境的音响品牌所做的扭亏为盈努力的信心。【原文：Sonos Inc. named interim leader Tom Conrad as its next chief executive officer, expressing confidence in the turnaround effort he’s pursuing at the embattled audio brand.】

item.title: 苹果公司推出每月 20 美元的 AppleCare One 计划，最多可覆盖三台设备
item.description: 苹果公司正在推出一项新的产品保险计划，捆绑多达三种设备的保险，这是苹果公司为增加订阅收入而做出的更广泛努力的一部分。【原文：Apple Inc. is launching a new product-insurance plan that bundles coverage for as many as three devices, part of a broader effort to drum up subscription revenue.】

item.title: Vanta 新一轮融资估值达 41.5 亿美元
item.description: 合规技术初创公司Vanta Inc.在新一轮1.5亿美元的融资中获得了41.5亿美元的估值— 使其价值增加了数十亿美元，同时也表明了投资者对使用人工智能简化复杂企业任务的公司的兴趣。【原文：Compliance tech startup Vanta Inc. reached a valuation of $4.15 billion in a new $150 million funding round — adding billions to its value, and signaling investors’ interest in companies using artificial intelligence to streamline complicated corporate tasks.】

item.title: 布鲁克菲尔德（Brookfield）错过了其首席执行官预见到的私募股权投资热潮
item.description: 布鲁斯-弗拉特的预测很明确：私募股权、房地产和基础设施的二级市场已经准备好起飞，对他的布鲁克菲尔德资产管理公司来说，这可能成为价值 500 亿美元的业务。【原文：Bruce Flatt was clear with his prediction: the secondary market for private equity, real estate and infrastructure was ready to take off, and it could become a $50 billion business for his Brookfield Asset Management.】

item.title: 银行软件支出推动销售反弹，Temenos 业绩飙升
item.description: Temenos AG 股价创下 2008 年以来最大涨幅，原因是这家瑞士公司出售了更多银行软件，金融机构也加大了投资力度。【原文：Temenos AG shares surged the most since 2008, as the Swiss company sold more of its banking software, with financial institutions stepping up investments.】

item.title: 哈里伯顿决定闲置压裂设备证实美国页岩开采放缓
item.description:
首席执行官表示，由于原油价格徘徊在每桶 70 美元以下，客户将在下半年削减开支。【原文：

Customers are cutting back in the second half as crude hangs below $70 a barrel, CEO says.

】

item.title: 土耳其有望自 3 月政治危机以来首次降息
item.description: 土耳其央行预计将自 3 月份政治危机以来首次降息，政治危机导致决策者扭转了宽松周期。【原文：Turkey’s central bank is expected to make its first interest-rate cut since a political crisis in March, which caused policymakers to reverse an easing cycle.】

item.title: 罗杰斯收购多伦多体育队后上调收入预期
item.description: 罗杰斯通信公司（Rogers Communications Inc. ）第二季度业绩超出分析师预期，其无线和媒体部门的销售额有所增长，在收购多伦多篮球队和冰球队的控制权后，该公司上调了 2025 年的收入预期。【原文：Rogers Communications Inc. beat analysts’ estimates in the second quarter, posting higher sales in its wireless and media divisions, and raised its 2025 revenue outlook after buying control of Toronto’s basketball and hockey teams.】

item.title: 荷兰银行警告：荷兰养老金改革将颠覆利率掉期交易
item.description: 荷兰银行（ABN Amro Bank NV）固定收益交易主管警告说，欧洲一些最大买家对长期利率对冲需求的崩溃将引发债券市场的波动。【原文：A collapse in demand for long-dated interest-rate hedges from some of the biggest buyers in Europe is set to ignite volatility in bond markets, the head of fixed income trading at ABN Amro Bank NV warns.】

item.title: Equinor 称政治因素导致的波动影响其能源交易
item.description: Equinor ASA公司表示，地缘政治动荡使这家挪威能源巨头的交易商们更难在这样的环境中开展业务，这凸显了欧洲石油和天然气巨头在准备公布第二季度收益时所面临的风险。【原文：Equinor ASA said that geopolitical volatility is making it a harder environment for the Norwegian energy giant’s traders to operate in, underscoring the risks facing Europe’s oil and gas majors as they get ready to report second-quarter earnings.】

item.title: 黑客利用 SharePoint 漏洞，微软受害者激增至 400 人
item.description: 据一家研究公司称，因微软公司的 SharePoint 服务器存在安全漏洞而受到攻击的公司和组织数量正在迅速增加，几天内受害者的数量猛增了六倍多。【原文：The number of companies and organizations compromised by a security vulnerability in Microsoft Corp.’s SharePoint servers is increasing rapidly, with the tally of victims soaring more than six-fold in a few days, according to one research firm.】

item.title: 津巴布韦称非正规经济部门占经济总量的 76
item.description: 根据津巴布韦第一次经济普查的结果，津巴布韦估计有四分之三以上的经济活动发生在非正规部门，使政府失去了急需的税收。【原文：Zimbabwe estimates that more than three-quarters of economic activity takes place in the informal sector, depriving the government of much-needed tax revenue, according to the findings of its first economic census.】

item.title: 数字部门衰退，阿达尼从 "超级应用 "雄心中撤退
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士透露，阿达尼集团在遭受巨额亏损和内部动荡之后，已经搁置了打造面向消费者的超级应用程序的计划，这标志着该集团从打造 "数字世界的法拉利 "的雄心壮志中撤退。【原文：The Adani Group has shelved its plans to build a consumer-facing super app after incurring significant losses and internal turmoil, people familiar with the matter said, marking a retreat from its ambitions to build “the Ferrari of the digital world.”】

item.title: 印度 Natco 公司同意收购阿德科克公司股份，阿德科克公司业绩再创新高
item.description: 在印度 Natco Pharma Ltd.表示将以约 2.32 亿美元的价格收购这家南非制药商的股份后，Adcock Ingram 控股有限公司的股价创下历史最高涨幅。【原文：Adcock Ingram Holdings Ltd. surged the most on record after India’s Natco Pharma Ltd. said it will acquire a stake in the South African drugmaker for about $232 million.】

item.title: 苹果、谷歌面临英国加强监管移动力量的规定
item.description: 英国反垄断监督机构针对苹果公司和谷歌的安卓系统制定了一系列新规则，以打击它们在移动生态系统中的势力，而这一市场几乎完全被这两家美国巨头所垄断。【原文：Apple Inc. and Google’s Android were earmarked by the UK’s antitrust watchdog for a raft of new rules targeting their power in mobile ecosystems, a market almost completely dominated by the US giants.】

item.title: 印度央行称农业和服务业提振印度经济活动
item.description: 印度储备银行在其月度公报中表示，尽管全球存在不确定性，但印度经济在很大程度上仍保持了活力，这主要得益于农业季节的强劲发展、服务业的强劲势头以及工业的适度增长。【原文：India’s economy remained largely resilient despite global uncertainties, due to a robust agricultural season, strong momentum in the services sector and modest industrial growth, the Reserve Bank of India said in its monthly bulletin.】
